DOC.brief_summary: This prospective randomized control study evaluate Long Acting Reversible Contraceptive ( LARC ) forward counsel combination same-day LARC placement increase overall LARC uptake within community college population compare LARC forward counsel referral secondary clinic LARC placement . The study conduct Mount Hood Community College ( MHCC ) Oregon . Participants enrol three group . All group receive standardize contraceptive counseling ( `` LARC forward counsel '' ) participant able choose LARC method short-acting method birth control .
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose study evaluate benefit on-campus birth control counsel service clinic . Currently health service provide access birth control locate Mount Hood Community College ( MHCC ) campus . We offer temporary 'Birth Control Resource Center ' eligible student . All form birth control study FDA approve . During study participant undergo counsel choose method birth control right . This include watch informational video discussion study staff . If participant choose pill , patch ring , diaphragm contraindication method , receive prescription method fill pharmacy choice . If participant choose Depo-Provera ( shot ) , receive first shot day visit prescription repeat shot every 3 month . If participant choose IUD Implant method birth control , randomize one two group . There 50 % chance IUD Implant place immediately counsel session 50 % chance receive list local clinic place device later time .
DOC.criteria: English Spanishspeaking woman . 1730 year age . Currently enrol 2year certificate program Mount Hood Community College . At risk pregnancy ( sexually active men anticipate become sexually active next 6 month ) . Do desire pregnancy within next 12 month . No contraindication LARC accord CDC MEC ( medical eligibility criterion ) Women currently sexually active men anticipate become sexually active male partner next 6 month . Women tubal ligation sterilization procedure . Women desire pregnancy within next 12 month . Women currently already use LARC method contraception .
